creator: willievu@yahoo.com
text:
The problem is in SecurityImplAllGrant's hasPermission().

When it loops through all permissions of an object node, it will throw an
ObjectNotFoundException if it stumbles over a missing subject in a permission. 
Permissions that have dangling subjects should be ignored gracesfully.

creator: ozeigermann@c1-fse.de
text:
In what scenario? Why is throwing an exception the wrong way to handle this? Can
you propose a patch?

The scenario is this.  /users is a custom store that retrieves users and groups
from LDAP server.  Users may be deleted outside of Slide.  If a group or users
is deleted in LDAP after it is granted permissions to an object node in Slide,
hasPermission() always throws ObjectNotFoundException when it tries to retrieve
the permission subject uri.

The following are the lines that cause ObjectNotFoundException:

SecurityImplAllGrant, rev. 1.6, 

line 169:

ObjectNode group = permissionSubjectUri.getStore().retrieveObject              
             (permissionSubjectUri);

line 189:

ObjectNode childNode = childUri.getStore().retrieveObject                      
                 (childUri);
creator: willievu@yahoo.com
ozeigermann@c1-fse.de
text:
Is this really a bug? I think this behavior might be the desired one in the
default scenario and maybe in others. What do you thing?

I believe this is a bug.  Take Linux or Windows for example.   A group or user
is granted permission to a file before the group or user is deleted.  The OS is
still able to retrieve the file and check permission on it.
creator: willievu@yahoo.com
pierre.damas@damas.be
text:
I confirm the behaviour on Windows.  In the list of users/groups having 
permissions on the file inspected, the missing group/user is represented by 
its SID (so the only link information in possession of the file server)

creator: ozeigermann@c1-fse.de
text:
I see. Anybody having any reason - maybe for backward compatibility - not to
change this?

OK, fixed this. Slide does echo a warning when subject has been removed, but
gracefully continues with the next subject.
